identity.name: E1
identity.mission: Create a high-octane, broadcast-grade rally interface that balances raw data density with TV-ready aesthetics.
core_principles: Speed is Clarity: Data must be readable at 200km/h.
Contrast is King: UI must pop against unpredictable video feeds and chroma backgrounds.
Monospace for Metrics: All timing data must use tabular figures for perfect vertical alignment.
The Grid is Sacred: Every element aligns to a strict broadcast safe-zone grid.

headings.usage: Stage names, Driver names, Scene titles

data.usage: Lap times, Split times, Leaderboard positions, Stream URLs

visual_enhancers.textures: Subtle carbon fiber pattern or diagonal scanlines on dark surfaces (optional)
visual_enhancers.gradients: None. Flat, solid colors for maximum readability.

StreamContainer.style: aspect-video bg-black relative overflow-hidden border-2 border-transparent data-[active=true]:border-primary

SceneSelector.style: flex gap-2 p-2 bg-secondary/50 backdrop-blur-sm rounded-lg border border-white/10
SceneSelector.item: px-4 py-2 text-sm font-bold uppercase hover:bg-primary hover:text-white transition-all data-[state=active]:bg-primary data-[state=active]:text-white

Scene 1 (Live Stage).layout: Grid of active streams (1x1, 2x2, or custom grid)
Scene 1 (Live Stage).overlay: Lower third showing Current SS Name + Stage Distance

Scene 2 (Timing Tower).layout: Split Screen: Left 25% Timing Tower (Vertical List), Right 75% Main Stream or Grid
Scene 2 (Timing Tower).data: Rank, Driver Name, Split Time, Gap to Leader

Scene 3 (Leaderboard).style: High density, showing all registered times for current SS

Scene 4 (Pilot Focus).layout: Single large stream + Stats Panel (Right side)
Scene 4 (Pilot Focus).stats: Driver Photo, Car Model, Team, Current Stage Time

Scene 5 (Split Comparison).layout: Horizontal Bar Chart comparison of top drivers

transitions.scene_switch: No fade. Instant cut or fast slide.

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. SETUP PAGE: Build a dense, data-heavy dashboard. Use Shadcn Tables for the Time Matrix. Use Shadcn Forms for Pilot/SS registration.
2. OVERLAY PAGE: This is a separate route (e.g., /overlay). It must have NO padding, NO margins on the body. It must be full viewport.
3. CHROMA KEY: The background of the /overlay route must be dynamically set by the user's choice (Green/Blue/Black).
4. STREAMS: Use <iframe> for ninja.vdo URLs. Ensure they are muted by default if multiple are active.
5. KEYBOARD SHORTCUTS: Implement a global listener for scene switching (Keys 1-5).
6. DATA PERSISTENCE: Use localStorage to save the entire state (pilots, stages, times, settings). Implement 'Export JSON' and 'Import JSON' buttons.
7. STYLE: Use 'Barlow Condensed' for all headers. It gives the WRC look immediately.
8. TESTING: Add data-testid to all inputs and scene selectors.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
